term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - short-range intramolecular interactions, in polymers
term.title: short-range intramolecular interactions

item.text: A steric or other interaction involving atoms or groups or both situated nearby in sequence along the chain. The interacting atoms or groups are typically separated by fewer than ten consecutive bonds in a chain. If no confusion can occur, the word 'intramolecular' may be omitted.

term.citation: Citation: 'short-range intramolecular interactions' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.S05649

term.disclaimer: The International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC) is continuously reviewing and, where needed, updating terms in the Compendium of Chemical Terminology (the IUPAC Gold Book). Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
